ex4D:plugin-description.p: This plugin gives access to the Address Book shared datastore from 4D.
Several mistakes in the mask constants are corrected. Added utility method AB LIST GROUP PEOPLE.
AB Get person property now accepts AB CreateDate and AB ModificationDate.
The project is now linked to the 10.5 SDK; the previous version required 10.6 or later. More specifically, instead of using NSRunningApplication for AB_TERMINATE, it now uses AppleScript.
The plugin ID has been changed from 10015 to 20000.

According to current specification, the constant ID of a plugin with an ID of 10000 for theme 1, 2â€¦ is 10000, 10001,.. and so on. This means that the ID of constants others than the primary theme can possibly clash with constants of another plugin.
To avoid such conflict, the ID of certain plugins may mauve to be adjusted.

This may have negative effect on existing code (4D methods) that are tokenized using the previous version. Users are advised to preserve the textual content of the method before replacing the plugin with a later version.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command terminates the Address Book application.
This command launches the Address Book application.
This command creates a new person record.

ex4D:return-value.label: person
ex4D:return-value.p: The record UUID of the newly created person record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command sets the specified property value of a person record.

ex4D:argument.label: value
ex4D:argument.p: The property value to set. Date value should be represented in text format.
Use the utility command AB Make date to composite date, time and timezone.

ex4D:return-value.label: success
ex4D:return-value.p: Returns 1 if successful, otherwise 0 or an error code.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command gets the specified property value of a person record.

ex4D:argument.label: value
ex4D:argument.p: The property value. Date value is represented in XML format.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command removes the specified person record from the data store.
This command sets the multi value property of a person. The first element will become the primary identifier.
This command gets the multi value property of a person.
This command sets the picture of a person record.
The picture should be supplied in png, pdf, jpg or tiff format.

ex4D:argument.label: image
ex4D:argument.p: The picture to set for this person record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command gets the picture of a person record.

ex4D:argument.label: image
ex4D:argument.p: The picture of this person record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command gets the vcard representation of a person record.

ex4D:argument.label: person
ex4D:argument.p: The record UUID of the newly created person record.

ex4D:argument.label: vcard
ex4D:argument.p: The vcard representation of this person record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command searches the data store for person records that meet the specified criteria.

ex4D:argument.label: key
ex4D:argument.p: The property key to query. Certain properties have keys, the address for example.

ex4D:argument.label: value
ex4D:argument.p: The property value to compare against.

ex4D:argument.label: comparison
ex4D:argument.p: The type of comparison to perform.

ex4D:argument.label: people
ex4D:argument.p: Text array of person record UUIDs found.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command creates a new person record from a vcard representation.

ex4D:return-value.label: person
ex4D:return-value.p: The record UUID of the newly created person record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command sets the flags of a person record.

ex4D:argument.label: flags
ex4D:argument.p: The new flags of this person record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command gets the flags of a person record.

ex4D:argument.label: flags
ex4D:argument.p: The flags of this person record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command returns the ID of record marked as me.

ex4D:return-value.label: person
ex4D:return-value.p: The person ID of the person set as me.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command sets a person as me. if an invalid ID is passed, there wil be no record set as me.

ex4D:argument.label: person
ex4D:argument.p: The person Id of the rocrd to set as me.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command creates a new group record.

ex4D:return-value.label: group
ex4D:return-value.p: The record UUID of the newly created group record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command sets the name of a group record.

ex4D:argument.label: name
ex4D:argument.p: The name to set for this group.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command gets the name of a group record.
This command removes the specifed group record from the data store.
This command removes the specifed person record from the specifed group.
This command adds the specifed group record to the specifed group.

ex4D:argument.label: group
ex4D:argument.p: The record UUID of the group to which the other group should be added.

ex4D:argument.label: subgroup
ex4D:argument.p: The record UUID of the group which should be contained in the other group.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command adds the specifed person record to the specifed group.

ex4D:argument.label: group
ex4D:argument.p: The record UUID of the group to which the person should be added.

ex4D:argument.label: person
ex4D:argument.p: The record UUID of the person which should be contained in the group.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command removes the specifed group record from the specifed group.

ex4D:argument.label: group
ex4D:argument.p: The record UUID of the group which contains the other group.

ex4D:argument.label: subgroup
ex4D:argument.p: The record UUID of the group which should be removed from the other group.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command gets all the person records in the specified group.

ex4D:argument.label: people
ex4D:argument.p: Text array of person record UUIDs.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command gets all the group records in the specified group.

ex4D:argument.label: groups
ex4D:argument.p: Text array of group record UUIDs.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command converts date, time and timezone information to an XML representation of a date record.

ex4D:return-value.label: date
ex4D:return-value.p: The XML representation of a date record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command extracts text values from an XML representation of a date record.

ex4D:argument.label: date
ex4D:argument.p: The XML representation of a date record.

ex4D:argument.label: offset
ex4D:argument.p: The timezone offset from GMT in seconds.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command converts text values to an XML representation of an address record.

ex4D:argument.label: countryCode
ex4D:argument.p: See country code list for valid values.

ex4D:return-value.label: address
ex4D:return-value.p: The XML representation of an address record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command extracts text values from an XML representation of an address record.

ex4D:argument.label: address
ex4D:argument.p: The XML representation of an address record.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command returns the UUIDs of records in the data store.

ex4D:argument.label: recordType
ex4D:argument.p: The type of records to retrieve.

ex4D:argument.label: condition
ex4D:argument.p: A query consition of the list to fetch.

ex4D:command-description.p: The localized string for this label or property.

ex4D:argument.label: string
ex4D:argument.p: The non-localized label or property name.

ex4D:return-value.label: localized
ex4D:return-value.p: The localized string for this label or property.

ex4D:return-value.label: countryCode
ex4D:return-value.p: See country code list for valid values.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command installs an event handler to be invoked for every addressbook update event.
The event handler receives 3 text aruguments, each containing lines of inserted record IDs, updated record IDs and deleted record IDs respectively.
This command returns the method name installed as the event handler for every addressbook update event.
This command gets all the parent group records of the specified group.

ex4D:argument.label: groups
ex4D:argument.p: Text array of group record UUIDs.

ex4D:command-description.p: This command allows one to retrive basic information about all the people who belongs to a group in one call.

ex4D:argument.label: firstNameFirst
ex4D:argument.p: Whether the record should show first name first. (ARRAY BOOLEAN).

ex4D:argument.label: showAsCompany
ex4D:argument.p: Whether the record should show as a company. (ARRAY BOOLEAN).

ex4D:argument.label: modifyDateAbosolute
ex4D:argument.p: The modification date, expressed in UNIX time (ARRAY REAL).

ex4D:command-description.p: This command searches the data store for person records that meet the specified multiple criteria.

ex4D:argument.label: keys
ex4D:argument.p: The property keys to query. Certain properties have keys, the address for example.

ex4D:argument.label: values
ex4D:argument.p: The property values to compare against.

ex4D:argument.label: comparisons
ex4D:argument.p: The type of comparison to perform.

ex4D:argument.label: conjunction
ex4D:argument.p: The type of conjunction to be applied to the set of conditions.

ex4D:argument.label: people
ex4D:argument.p: Text array of person record UUIDs found.

ex4D:command-description.p: Get the parent groups to which the group belongs.
Get the parent groups to which the person belongs.
